tit.cmt: 用語集の表記に修正しました。

sen.j: ミカド商会（-しょうかい、1919年7月10日 設立 - 1920年1月 吸収）は、かつて存在した日本の映画会社である。
sen.e: Mikado Shokai (- Shokai established on July 10, 1919 - Acquired on January 1920) is a Japanese film studio that once existed.
The Mikado Company (- Shokai, established on July 10, 1919 - Acquired on January 1920) is a Japanese film studio that once existed.
sen.cmt: Mikado Shokai を The Mikado Company に修正しました。※ - Shokai は意味をなさないように思われます。
sen.e: The Mikado Company (- Shokai, established on July 10, 1919 - Acquired on January 1920) is a Japanese film studio that once existed.

sen.j: 映画監督となったのちの「日本映画の父」牧野省三が初めて起こした会社である。
sen.e: It was the first company that Shozo MAKINO, the 'Father of Japanese cinema', established after he became a movie director.
It was the first company that Shozo MAKINO, the 'father of Japanese cinema,' established after he became a movie director.
sen.cmt: Father of Japanese cinema', をfather of Japanese film,' に修正しました。
sen.e: It was the first company that Shozo MAKINO, the 'father of Japanese cinema,' established after he became a movie director.

sen.j: 短命に終わり、日活に吸収されるが、牧野の独立はその2年後に本格化する。
sen.e: It was short-lived and was absorbed by Nikkatsu, but 2 years later, MAKINO would begin to consider going independent in earnest.
It was short-lived and was absorbed by Nikkatsu, but in two years later, Makino began to run his own business seriously.
sen.cmt: 後半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: It was short-lived and was absorbed by Nikkatsu, but in two years later, Makino began to run his own business seriously.

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）来、横田永之助の横田商会、1912年（大正元年）の4社合併後の日活で牧野省三は映画監督として活躍していた。
sen.e: Shozo MAKINO worked actively as a movie director, first at Einosuke YOKOTA's Yokota Shokai from 1908, and then at Nikkatsu after the 4 company merger in 1912.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: しかし、日活からの独立を望んだ。
sen.e: But he desired independence from Nikkatsu.

sen.j: 「教育映画に限る」という約束で日活在籍のまま、1919年（大正8年）7月10日に設立したのが、同社である。
sen.e: With promise that he would limit his movies to "just educational movies", he established this company on July 10, 1919, while still working for Nikkatsu.

sen.j: 顧問に文部省通俗教育調査員の星野辰男を迎えた。
sen.e: He welcomed Tatsuo HOSHINO, a member of the Inquiry Committee of Popular Education in Ministry of Education, as an adviser.
He welcomed Tatsuo HOSHINO, a member of the Inquiry Committee of Popular Education in Ministry of Education, as an adviser.
He welcomed Tatsuo HOSHINO, a member of the Inquiry Committee of Popular Education in Ministry of Education, as an adviser.

sen.j: 星野とは、文部省勤務ながら、この前年モーリス・ルブランの『怪盗紳士ルパン』を初めて邦訳した保篠龍緒である。
sen.e: This HOSHINO is the same Tatsuo HOSHINO that first translated Maurice LEBLANC's "Arsene Lupin, Gentleman Cambrioleur" the year before while still working for the Ministry of Education.

sen.j: 日活時代に牧野の助監督であった金森万象、撮影助手の花房種太、浜田行雄を抜擢した。
sen.e: MAKINO recruited Bansho KANAMORI, his former assistant director, as well as Taneta HANABUSA and Yukio HAMADA, his former assistant cameramen.

sen.j: 4巻ものの劇映画『都に憧れて』、2巻ものの短篇劇映画『忠孝の亀鑑 小楠公』の脚本を金森に書かせて監督させた。
sen.e: He had KANAMORI script and direct 4 volumes of narrative film titled "Yearning for the City", and 2 volumes of short narrative film titled "Tadataka no Kikan Shonanko".

sen.j: これらは花房・浜田に撮影をさせた。
sen.e: He had HANABUSA and HAMADA shoot these films.

sen.j: 1巻もののドキュメンタリー映画『処女会表彰記念会式 (広島県沼隈郡処女会)』を撮影するため、金森と花房を広島県沼隈郡（現在の同県福山市）の「処女会」に派遣して撮ってこさせた。
sen.e: To film a 1 volume documentary movie titled "Shojokai Hyosho Kinenshiki (Numakuma-gun, Hiroshima Prefecture Shojokai)", he sent KANAMORI and HANABUSA to 'Shojokai' in Numakuma-gun, Hiroshima Prefecture (current Fukuyama-shi of the same prefecture).

sen.j: 俳優部は嵐璃珀を除いて、娘の富栄、息子のマキノ雅弘、マキノ満男、異父妹の京子、その夫の片岡市太郎といった牧野の親族であった。
sen.e: His actors division, except for Rihaku ARASHI, consisted of MAKINO's relatives: his daughter Tomie, his sons Masahiro MAKINO and Mitsuo MAKINO, his half sister Kyoko, and her husband Ichitaro KATAOKA.

sen.j: いずれも無声映画である。

sen.j: この3本は、同年11月30日、湯島聖堂構内の東京教育博物館（現在の国立科学博物館）で公開された。
sen.e: These three films were shown at Tokyo Educational Museum (current National Museum of Nature and Science) located within Yushima Seido (Sacred Hall at Yushima) on November 30th of the same year.

sen.j: 脅威を感じた日活の横田は、そのわずか１か月後1920年（大正9年）1月に同社を吸収、「日活教育映画部」とした。
sen.e: Feeling the threat, YOKOTA of Nikkatsu absorbed the said company on January 1920, just one month after the showing, and named it 'Nikkatsu Educational Film Department'.

sen.j: 監督の金森は牧野の助監督に戻り、カメラマンの浜田は撮影助手として日活に戻った。
sen.e: Director KANAMORI returned to being an assistant director to MAKINO, and cameraman HAMADA returned to Nikkatsu as an assistant cameraman.

sen.j: 花房は東京へ行き、高松豊次郎が「ミカド商会」と同時期に設立した「活動写真資料研究会」製作の鉄道省肝いりの映画『鉄道と公徳』の撮影技師をつとめた。

sen.j: 牧野は、ふたたび立ち上がり、翌年6月に「牧野教育映画製作所」を設立する。
sen.e: MAKINO sought independence again and established 'Makino Educational Films' on June of the following year.

sen.e: Until then, he indifferently continued as a director for a film starring Matsunosuke ONOE at Nikkatsu Studio.
